Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game during Friday evening peak.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

NRL: Eels v Titans at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 6:15pm, finish around 8:15pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd. Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close from approximately 8pm to 8:30pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell Street from Grose Street to George Street
  • Ross Street from O’Connell Street to Trott Street
  • Victoria Road from O’Connell Street to Villiers Street

Fans should follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police and allow extra time when exiting car parks. If you’re travelling home by taxi or ride share choose a pick up location away from the stadium to avoid traffic delays.NR

Disney On Ice at Qudos Bank Arena. Wednesday 12 to Sunday 16 July.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Please note on Wednesday 12 July, the Sydney Olympic Park precinct will be very busy as State of Origin takes place at Accor Stadium. Those driving to the evening session are urged to pre-book parking to secure a space, and to expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time.

Traffic will be heavier be heavier than usual and parking in high demand as families travel to the venue for the shows especially during commuter evening peak.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Tickets include travel on transport. Express trains and major event buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
State of Origin Game III at Accor Stadium at Olympic Park. Kick off 8:05pm. Finish approx 10pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the precinct as thousands of fans travel to the stadium during the busy evening peak.

Allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Some local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will close as early as 5pm on Tuesday 11 July and some will stay closed until 3am on Thursday 13 July. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site.

If you're driving from the north, use Silverwater Rd, Holker St and Hill Rd to access to precinct car parks and avoid heavy traffic expected on Homebush Bay Drive and Underwood Rd.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: Some buses will be diverting around the closures. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 6,000 participants will take part in the annual Sutherland 2 Surf fun run and walk from Sutherland to Cronulla via the Kingsway from 7.30am. Roads around the start area will close from 5am with all closures in place by 7.40am. Roads progressively reopen from 8.20am, with all roads reopened by 10:30am.

ROAD CLOSURES:

  • Sutherland from 5am: sections of Flora St and Acacia Rd.
  • Gymea to Cronulla from 7am to 10am: the eastbound lanes of the Kingsway will be closed from the Princes Hwy to Elouera Rd, and will progressively reopen from 8.50am. The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h on the Kingsway westbound lanes from 7am, delays are expected. Motorists travelling north of the Kingsway should use The Boulevarde/Captain Cook Dr. Motorists travelling south of the Kingsway should use President Ave.
  • Kirrawee from 7am: Bath Rd South, Clements Pde and Oak Rd. The Kingsway will be closed in both directions between Talara Rd and the Princes Hwy from 7.20am to 8.20am.
  • Caringbah from 7am: Banksia Rd, Denman Ave and Yathong Rd.
  • Miranda / Caringbah from 7am: southbound lanes of Kiora Rd, Port Hacking Rd and Taren Point Rd.
  • Woolooware from 7am: Dolans Rd, Fowler St and Hughes St.
  • Cronulla from 5am: Mitchell Rd, Elouera Rd and Prince St. While Elouera Rd is closed between 7.30am and 9:50am access to North Cronulla access is via Captain Cook Dr and access to South Cronulla access is via President Ave and Burraneer Bay Rd.

Motorists will still be able to cross the Kingsway at various points before and after runners pass major intersections including at Hotham Rd, Milburn Rd/Gymea Bay Rd, Sylvania Rd, Wandella Rd, Kiora Rd, Kareena Rd, Taren Point Rd and Gannons Rd.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will not be in place, however vehicles parked along the route cannot be moved while the event is underway. Greenhills car park in Cronulla will be closed from 4pm Sat 16 July until midday Sun 17 July to accommodate the event finish line.

arrangementElements.html:
FROM 4PM SATURDAY 15 JULY TO 12PM SUNDAY 16 JULY: Greenhills Beach car park from the corner of Mitchell Road and Murdock Street, Cronulla.


SUNDAY 16 JULY


SUTHERLAND 

FROM 5:00AM TO 9:15AM

  • Flora Street between Merton Street and Belmont Street

FROM 6:30AM TO 8:00AM

  • Flora Street between Eton Street and Merton Street

FROM 7:15AM TO 8:00AM

  • Acacia Road(1) between Princes Highway and President Avenue

(1)Local Sutherland detour in place while Acacia Road closed. Northbound detour may not be suitable for heavy vehicles.


KIRRAWEE - FROM 7:00AM TO 8:20AM

(3)Access to Kirrawee Station and shopping precinct via President Avenue.

BETWEEN 7:00AM AND 10:00AM

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

arrangementElements.html:
Roads crossing the Kingsway will close and reopen as the event passes through, between 7:20am and 9:45am.

Motorists will be able to cross the Kingsway at locations before and after runners pass major intersections at:

  • Hotham Road before 7:20am and after 8am
  • Milburn Road/Gymea Bay Road before 7:20am and after 8am
  • Sylvania Road before 7:20am and after 8:20am
  • Wandella Road before 7:20am and after 8:40am
  • Kiora Road before 7:30am and after 8:50am
  • Kareena Road before 7:30am and after 9:10am
  • Taren Point Road before 7:40am and after 9:10am
  • Gannons Road before 7:40am and after 9:25am
  • Elourea Road before 7:30am and after 9:45am
arrangementElements.title: Kingsway Crossover Points

arrangementElements.html:
SUNDAY 16 JULY - FROM 7AM TO 10AM

The Kingsway westbound lanes will be open between Cronulla and Gymea Bay Road, Gymea, with a reduced speed limit of 40km/hr in place between 7am and 10:00am. A section of the Kingsway westbound from Gymea Bay Road to the Princes Highway will be closed between 7:20am and 8:20am.

properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the 10th annual Bastille Festival from Tursday 13 to Sunday 16 July. Events run from 12pm-10pm Thursday, 10am-11pm Friday & Saturday and 10am - 8pm on Sunday.

The festival will be held at various locations around Circular Quay including Customs House (on Alfred St), Loftus St and the Gateway Plaza Forecourt areas.

Loftus Street between Reiby Place and Alfred Street, and the eastbound lanes of Custom House Lane between Loftus Street and Young Street, will be closed during the following times to safely facilitate the event: 

  • Thursday 13 July: 12pm to 10pm
  • Friday 14 & Saturday 15 July: 10am to 11pm
  • Sunday 16 July: 10am to 8pm

There are no programmed Special Event Clearways for this event.

roads.mainStreet: Alfred Street and Loftus Street

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Western Bulldogs at SCG. First bounce from 7:20pm and full time around 10pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as thousands of fans travel to the stadium during Thursday evening peak. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 1:45pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP2 Kippax car park will be maintained via Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park maintained from Lang Rd.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 10pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
All FIFA Women’s World Cup™ Australia and New Zealand tournament matches will also be streamed live on the big screen at Sydney’s FIFA Fan Festival™ in Tumbalong Park, Darling Harbour. Cheer on your team while also enjoying an exciting football and entertainment programme during the tournament.

Opening Dates* subject to change:

  • Thursday 20th July – Thursday 3rd August
  • Saturday 5th – Tuesday 8th August
  • Friday 11th – Saturday 12th August
  • Tuesday 15th – Wednesday 16th August
  • Saturday 19th – Sunday 20th August

Fans are encouraged to catch public transport.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads throughout the Sydney CBD.

properties.publicTransport: Light rail services and buses may experience some delays, check service alerts at transportnsw.info for the latest information.
properties.otherAdvice:
Rolling road closures will be in place in the Sydney CBD between 1pm and 2pm for a planned Police Operation protest march.

Sections of Elizabeth St, Hunter St, Pitt St, King St and Castlereagh St will be closed between Martin Place and Belmore Park. Roads will progressively re-open when safe to do so.

Motorists should avoid the area during this time or expect delays and follow the directions of NSW Police on site

Large crowds are expected to attend the annual 3-day Splendour in the Grass music festival in North Byron Parklands.

There will be an increase in traffic volumes on roads approaching the Parklands site including the M1 Pacific Mwy (particularly at the Yelgun Interchange), Tweed Valley Way, Brunswick Valley Way and Yelgun Rd as crowds arrive on Wednesday and Thursday, and on Monday as festival goers leave.

Changed traffic conditions and traffic control will be in place on approach to the event site.

Festival goers are encouraged to allow plenty of extra travel time, carpool where possible and follow the directions of traffic controllers when accessing the site.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Frequent light rail and buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
FIFA Women’s World Cup™: Round of 16 at Sydney Football Stadium. Kick-off at 12pm, finish approx 1.45pm, subject to extra time and penalties.

With up to 40,000 fans expected significant traffic delays are expected on roads in the area. Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Both grass car parks on Driver Ave will not be open to the public on match days. Parking in the precinct is extremely limited. If you have to drive, carpool with your group and plan to arrive early. Parking is available in Entertainment Quarter Wilson car park, Sydney Boys & Girls High School on Cleveland St and off-site parking will be available at Royal Randwick Racecourse (entry via Ascot St).

Local closures will be in place to safely manage crowds:

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 9am and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.
  • The Moore Park Rd and Fitzroy St cycleway will temporarily close from 9am to 4pm before, during and after the game.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 8am to 4pm on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St. Clearways will also be in effect on both sides of Driver Ave between Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd for the entire day on match days from 12.01am to 11.59pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 8,000 people will take part in the annual Sydney Harbour 10k and 5k on Sunday morning.

Events start from George St in The Rocks from 7:30am. The course travels around the harbour foreshore using on and off-road pathways via Dawes Point, Millers Point, Barangaroo, King St Wharf , Darling Harbour and Pyrmont. To safely facilitate the fun run, road closures will be in place.

ROAD CLOSURES:

  • 4am to 1pm: Circular Quay West at the OPT
  • 4:30am to 11am: George St from Alfred St to Hickson Rd and Hickson Rd from George St to Park Hyatt
  • 6am to 10am: Hickson Rd between Napoleon St and Barton St and northbound lanes Sussex St from King St to Erskine St and Slip St
  • 6am to 11am: Hickson Rd from Park Hyatt to Barton St and Napoleon St between Kent St and Hickson St. Hickson Rd from George St in The Rocks through to Erskine St at King Street Wharf as well as sections of Dalgety Rd, Napoleon St, Towns Pl, Waterman’s Quay and Barangaroo Ave
  • 7:30am to 10am: Sections Murray St & Pirrama Rd, Wharf Cres, Darling Island Rd and Wharf 7/10 Service Rd in Pyrmont.
  • 8:30am to 9:30am: Cuthbert St, King St, Lime St, Erskine St and Shelley St at King St Wharf

Changed local access arrangements will be in place around King Street Wharf/Barangaroo between 8:30am and 9:15am and in Pyrmont between 7:30am and 10am.

arrangementElements.html:
SYDNEY CBD / THE ROCKS 

4:30AM TO 11AM

  • George Street between Alfred Street and Hickson Road 
  • Hickson Rd between George St and Park Hyatt
  • Upper Roadway from Hickson Road to Overseas Passenger Terminal

THE ROCKS

FROM 4AM TO 1PM

  • Circular Quay West from Argyle Street

FROM 6AM TO 11AM

  • Dalgety Road between Windmill Street and Towns Place
  •  Hickson Road between Towns Barton St and Park Hyatt
  • Towns Place between Dalgety Road and Hickson Road
  • Napoleon Street between Kent Street and Sussex Street

BARANGAROO / DAWES POINT / MILLERS POINT    

FROM 6AM TO 10AM

  • Hickson Rd between Napoleon St and Barton St
  • Slip Street from Sussex Street
  • Sussex Street between Napoleon Street and Erskine Street
  • Sussex Street between King Street and Erskine Street (Northbound)
  • Barton St from Hickson Rd

PYRMONT

FROM 7AM TO 9:30AM

  • Murray Street 1 between Darling Drive and Pirrama Road
  • Pirrama Road 2 between Murray Street and Jones Bay Road
  • Wharf 7 & 10 access road 3 from Pirrama Road
  • Wharf Cres from Darling Island Rd to Darling Island Rd

1 No access to or from Australian National Maritime Museum.

2 Exit only from The Star carpark northbound on Pirrama Road. Access to Star Casino via Edward St.

3 Exit only until 8.00am northbound on Pirrama Road.


CYCLEWAY CLOSURE

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 8:30AM TO 9:30AM

  • King St 1 between Kent St and Sussex Street

1. Cycleway detour from Pyrmont Bridge to Kent Street and vice versa via Market Street Road bridge.

 

SHARED PATHWAY CLOSURE

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 8:30AM TO 9:30AM

  • King Street off ramp between Pyrmont Bridge and Sussex Street

properties.publicTransport: Tickets include travel on transport. Express trains and major event buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
FIFA Women’s World Cup™: Australia v Republic of Ireland at Stadium Australia in Sydney Olympic Park. Kick off 8pm. Finish approx 9.55pm.

Traffic will be heavy approaching the precinct as 80,000 fans travel to the stadium during the busy Thursday evening peak. Fans are urged to leave the car at home and catch transport.

Expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • If you have to drive, it’s essential to pre-book parking online in advance to secure a space available until 11:59pm the night before the game unless sold out prior.
  • Note P1 car park next to Stadium Australia is sold out on this match day and will only be available to fans holding a FIFA-endorsed vehicle access pass. Limited parking is available to pre-book at other nearby car parks within the precinct but will fill quickly. If you have pre-booked, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry. If you're driving from the north, use Silverwater Rd, Holker St and Hill Rd to access to precinct car parks and avoid heavy traffic expected on Homebush Bay Drive and Underwood Rd. 

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will close from the night before and reopen the morning after the game. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site.

arrangementElements.html:
See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details.

properties.otherAdvice:
FIFA Women’s World Cup™: Germany v Colombia at Sydney Football Stadium. Kick-off at 7.30pm, finish approx 9.15pm.

With up to 40,000 fans expected motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Both grass car parks on Driver Ave will not be open to the public on match days. Parking in the precinct is extremely limited. If you have to drive, carpool with your group and plan to arrive early. Parking is available in Entertainment Quarter Wilson car park, Sydney Boys & Girls High School on Cleveland St and off-site parking will be available at Royal Randwick Racecourse (entry via Ascot St).

Local closures will be in place to safely manage crowds:

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4.30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.
  • The Eastern Distributor Off-Ramp to Moore Park Road (Bondi Exit) will close from 9pm to 10:30pm.
  • The Moore Park Rd and Fitzroy St cycleway will temporarily close on from 4:30pm to 11:30pm before, during and after the game.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to midnight on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Chalmers St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St. Clearways will also be in effect on both sides of Driver Ave between Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd for the entire day on match days from 12.01am to 11.59pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)

From 3pm to 8pm: Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Randle Street (western side)

24-hour clearways: both sides of Driver Avenue between Moore Park Rod and Lang Road for the entire day on match days from 12.01am to 11.59pm.

If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Frequent light rail and buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
FIFA Women’s World Cup™: England v Denmark at Sydney Football Stadium. Kick-off at 6.30pm, finish approx 8.15pm.

With up to 40,000 fans expected significant traffic delays are expected on roads in the area during the already busy Friday evening peak. Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Both grass car parks on Driver Ave will not be open to the public on match days. Parking in the precinct is extremely limited. If you have to drive, carpool with your group and plan to arrive early. Parking is available in Entertainment Quarter Wilson car park, Sydney Boys & Girls High School on Cleveland St and off-site parking will be available at Royal Randwick Racecourse (entry via Ascot St).

Local closures will be in place to safely manage crowds:

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 3.30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.
  • The Eastern Distributor Off-Ramp to Moore Park Road (Bondi Exit) will close from 8pm to 9:30pm. 
  • The Moore Park Rd and Fitzroy St cycleway will temporarily close on from 3:30pm to 10:30pm before, during and after the game.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Chalmers St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St. Clearways will also be in effect on both sides of Driver Ave between Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd for the entire day on match days from 12.01am to 11.59pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

FIFA Women’s World Cup™: Colombia v Korea at Sydney Football Stadium. Kick-off at 12pm, finish approx 1.45pm.

With up to 40,000 fans expected motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Both grass car parks on Driver Ave will not be open to the public on match days. Parking in the precinct is extremely limited. If you have to drive, carpool with your group and plan to arrive early. Parking is available in Entertainment Quarter Wilson car park only and off-site parking will be available at Royal Randwick Racecourse (entry via Ascot St). 

Local closures will be in place to safely manage crowds:

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 9am and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.
  • The Moore Park Rd and Fitzroy St cycleway will temporarily close from 9am to 3pm before, during and after the game.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 9am to 3pm on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St. Clearways will also be in effect on both sides of Driver Ave between Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd for the entire day on match days from 12.01am to 11.59pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.
